utterances.U1: Doctor: What seems to be the trouble, Mr. Burke?
utterances.U3: Patient: My body aches. I have a runny nose and a bad cough.
utterances.U5: Doctor: Yes, your temperature is very high, too.
utterances.U6: Doctor: You have a fever. It looks like you have the flu. Do you have any allergies? I don't think so. Okay, great. I'm going to prescribe some medicine. Please take it twice every day. Once in the morning and once before bed. You should feel better in a few days. Great, thank

S.sentence_text: Patient reports feeling terrible, with body aches, runny nose, and a bad cough.
The patient has a fever of 103C and a runny nose and cough.

O.sentence_text: Physical examination revealed a fever and body aches.

A.sentence_text: The patient is suspected of having the flu.
The patient is prescribed two doses of flu medicine twice daily.
The patient is advised to take it twice daily in the morning and once before bed.
The primary diagnosis is the flu, with the patient's symptoms suggestive of the virus.
The prognosis is good with medication and supportive care.

P.sentence_text: The patient is advised to take two doses of flu medicine twice daily.
The patient is advised to monitor his symptoms closely and report any changes.
